observation: Cracks visible along the left front track roller, metal stress lines extending 2 inches
rationale: Cracked roller can collapse under operational load causing sudden track derailment and machine tipping
recommended_action: Remove machine from service immediately. Replace front track roller before next operation.
manual_reference: D6N Operation Manual p.84 - Undercarriage Inspection

observation: Oil seep around final drive seal, light film coating visible on housing
rationale: Minor seal weep indicates early seal degradation. Not yet at risk of failure but will worsen under continued operation
recommended_action: Schedule final drive seal replacement within 50 service hours. Monitor oil level daily.
manual_reference: D6N Service Manual - Final Drive Maintenance

observation: Blade cutting edge worn but still within spec, uniform wear pattern across entire edge
rationale: Cutting edge within acceptable wear limits. No structural damage observed.
recommended_action: Continue monitoring. Plan replacement at next scheduled PM.
manual_reference: D6N Maintenance Manual - Blade Wear Specs

observation: Hydraulic cylinder rod shows scoring marks and pitting on chrome surface, 3 inch section affected
rationale: Rod scoring damages seals on every stroke, causing accelerating hydraulic fluid loss and loss of blade control
recommended_action: Remove machine from service. Replace cylinder rod and seals before next operation.
manual_reference: D6N Service Manual - Hydraulic Cylinder Inspection

observation: Track tension slightly loose, sag measurement 2.5 inches at mid-span
rationale: Track sag exceeds recommended 1.5-2 inch spec. Over-loose track increases wear on sprockets and rollers
recommended_action: Adjust track tension to spec before next shift. Recheck after 8 hours of operation.
manual_reference: D6N Operation Manual - Track Tension Adjustment p.52
